ICALDS - Comprehensive Code Analyzer

Analyze your code to identify patterns, algorithms, data structures, and get educational insights with our advanced analysis engine

Code Analysis & Insights

How to use: Paste your code in the editor below and click "Analyze Code" to get detailed insights about patterns, algorithms, data structures, complexity, and educational recommendations.

GitHub Pages Demo Version

This is a static demo version of ICALDS hosted on GitHub Pages. For the full interactive experience with real code analysis:

Try it now: Enter your code below and click "Analyze Code" to see sample results.

Cloud Deployment Options

To enable real code analysis on GitHub Pages, deploy the API to a cloud service:

1
Deploy the API to a cloud service (examples):
  • Railway: Easy deployment with free tier
  • Heroku: Popular platform-as-a-service
  • AWS: Amazon Web Services
  • DigitalOcean: Simple cloud hosting
2
Update the API endpoint in the web interface code:
// In src/lib.rs, change the API URL to your deployed service let api_url = "https://your-deployed-api.example.com/analyze";
3
Redeploy the GitHub Pages site with the updated configuration

Note: This requires setting up a database and configuring environment variables for the deployed API.

Run ICALDS Locally

1
Clone the repository:
git clone https://github.com/attakdefand/icadLS.git
2
Navigate to the project directory:
cd icadLS
3
Run the services (requires two terminals):
# Terminal 1: Start the API server cd services/analyzer-api && cargo run
# Terminal 2: Start the web interface cd clients/web-advisor-wasm && trunk serve --port 8082
4
Open your browser at http://localhost:8082 and start analyzing code!

Sample Analysis Results & Educational Insights

Complexity: Medium

Patterns Detected

  • Nested loop pattern
  • Array traversal
  • Element swapping
  • Conditional comparison

Algorithms Detected

  • Bubble Sort
  • Array Printing

Data Structures Detected

  • Vector (Dynamic Array)
  • Primitive Types (i32)

Detailed Algorithm Information

  • Bubble Sort (Sorting)
    A simple sorting algorithm that repeatedly steps through the list, compares adjacent elements and swaps them if they are in the wrong order.
    Learn more on Wikipedia

Detailed Data Structure Information

  • Vector (Dynamic Array)
    A contiguous growable array type with heap-allocated contents.
    Learn more on Wikipedia

Recommendations

  • Consider using more efficient sorting algorithms like Quick Sort or Merge Sort for larger datasets
  • The current implementation has O(n²) time complexity
  • For better performance with large arrays, consider using the built-in sort() method
  • To analyze your own code: Try the Cloud Deployment or Local Setup options above
